docs.title: Welcome to {{prodname}} documentation
docs.text:
{% include-markdown "topic1.md" start="" end="" %}

To log into {{prodname}} Foundry Engagement Services, follow these steps:

{% if os == "windows" %} 1. On your Windows computer, specify this environment variable. {% else %} 1. On your Linux computer, pass this shell command. {% endif %} 2. Open an Internet browser. 3. Enter the Volt MX Foundry Engagement Services URL in the Address field in the browser, Volt MX Foundry Engagement Services console URL is http://:/vpns 

Example: http://localhost:8080/vpns
  1. Press the Enter key. The Volt MX Foundry Engagement Services Login screen appears.
  1. Enter the user name in the Username field.
  2. Enter the password in the Password field.
  3. Click the Sign in button. The Dashboard page appears as the landing page in the console.

{% include-markdown "topic1.md" %}

docs.title: Survey of features
docs.text:
Some of the more prominent features of this theme include the following:

  • Bootstrap framework
  • Navgoco multi-level sidebar for table of contents
  • Ability to specify different sidebars for different products
  • Top navigation bar with drop-down menus
  • Notes, tips, and warning information notes
  • Advanced landing page layouts from the Modern Business theme.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This site provides documentation, training, and other notes for the Jekyll Documentation theme. There's a lot of information about how to do a variety of things here, and it's not all unique to this theme. But by and large, understanding how to do things in Jekyll depends on how your theme is coded. As a result, these additional details are provided.

From topic2 MD File The instructions here are geared towards technical writers working on documentation. You may have a team of one or more technical writers working on documentation for multiple projects. You can use this same theme to author all of your documentation for each of your products. The theme is built to accommodate documentation for multiple products on the same site.

To log into {{prodname}} Foundry Engagement Services, follow these steps:

{% if os == "windows" %} 1. On your Windows computer, specify this environment variable. {% else %} 1. On your Linux computer, pass this shell command. {% endif %} 2. Open an Internet browser. 3. Enter the Volt MX Foundry Engagement Services URL in the Address field in the browser, Volt MX Foundry Engagement Services console URL is http://:/vpns 

Example: http://localhost:8080/vpns

  1. Press the Enter key. The Volt MX Foundry Engagement Services Login screen appears.

  2. Enter the user name in the Username field.

  3. Enter the password in the Password field.
  4. Click the Sign in button. The Dashboard page appears as the landing page in the console.
